catalog_info.title: Psychology and Economics
catalog_info.notes: Psychological concepts include social preferences, impulsivity, bounded rationality, loss-aversion, over-confidence, self-serving biases, hedonics, and neuroscience. Economic concepts include arbitrage, equilibrium, rational choice, utility maximization, Bayesian beliefs, game theory. Integrates these psychological and economic concepts to understand behavioral phenomena such as portfolio choice, saving, procrastination, addiction, asset pricing, auction bidding, labor supply, cooperation, persuasion. Tu., Th., 1–2:30
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: Ec 10a and Ec 10b and knowledge of univariate calculus.
